hints.label: lem-electric-field-correspondence
hints.title: Electric Field Lattice-Continuum Correspondence
hints.content:
42: :label: lem-electric-field-correspondence
43: 
44: For a gauge field on an irregular lattice edge $e$ connecting sites $i,j$ separated by distance $d_{ij} = \|x_i - x_j\|$, the lattice electric field $E_e^{(a)}$ is related to the continuum electric field $E_k^{(a)}(x)$ by:
45: 
46: $$
47: E_e^{(a)} = \frac{d_{ij}}{g^2} E_k^{(a)}(x_{ij})
48: $$
49: 
50: where $x_{ij} = \frac{1}{2}(x_i + x_j)$ is the midpoint.
51: 
52: **Proof**: From the source Hamiltonian normalization, the lattice electric field is defined as the canonical momentum:
53: 
54: $$
55: E_e^{(a)} = \frac{\partial H_{\text{gauge}}}{\partial \dot{A}_e^{(a)}}
56: $$
57: 
58: The continuum electric field is $E_k = -F_{0k} = \partial_0 A_k - D_k A_0$. For temporal gauge ($A_0 = 0$):
59: 
60: $$
61: E_k^{(a)}(x) = \partial_0 A_k^{(a)}(x) = \dot{A}_k^{(a)}(x)
62: $$
63: 
64: The lattice field $A_e$ is the line integral: $A_e \sim \int_i^j A_k dx^k \approx d_{ij} A_k(x_{ij})$.
65: 
66: Taking time derivatives and matching to the source Hamiltonian coefficient: $E_e = \frac{d_{ij}}{g^2}\dot{A}_k = \frac{d_{ij}}{g^2} E_k$.

hints.label: lem-wilson-irregular-cycles
hints.title: Wilson Loop Area Law for Irregular Cycles
hints.content:
99: :label: lem-wilson-irregular-cycles
100: 
101: For an elementary cycle $\square$ in the Interaction Graph connecting walkers $(i \to j \to k \to \ell \to i)$ with edge lengths $d_{ij}, d_{jk}, d_{k\ell}, d_{\ell i}$, the Wilson loop satisfies:
102: 
103: $$
104: U_{\square} = \exp\left(ig \mathcal{A}_{\square} \bar{F}_{ij}^{(a)} \tau^{(a)} + O(d^3)\right)
105: $$
106: 
107: where:
108: - $\mathcal{A}_{\square} = \frac{1}{2}|\vec{r}_{ij} \times \vec{r}_{ik}|$ is the **projected area** of the cycle onto its best-fit plane
109: - $\bar{F}_{ij}^{(a)} = \frac{1}{\mathcal{A}_{\square}}\int_{\square} F_{ij}^{(a)} dA$ is the **average field strength** over the cycle
